H0.text: Fragments that broke off of older rocks are the source materials of the particles that make up sandstone and all other types of sedimentary rock.

H1.text: Magma that cooled deep below a volcano is the source material of the particles that make up sandstone and all other types of sedimentary rock.

H2.text: Gases that condensed in the atmosphere are the source materials of the particles that make up sandstone and all other types of sedimentary rock.

H3.text: Vegetation that decayed in thick layers is the source material of the particles that compose sandstone and all other types of sedimentary rock.

A4.text: Geological detritus originates from weathering and erosion of existing rocks.

A5.text: Vegetation gets compressed by overlying sediments and undergoes chemical transformation.

A6.text: Siliciclastic sedimentary rocks are composed of mainly silicate particles derived from the weathering of older rocks and pyroclastic volcanism.

A7.text: Sedimentary breccias are a type of clastic sedimentary rock which are composed of angular to subangular, randomly oriented clasts of other sedimentary rocks.
